column4: Can I install a new kernel only with the install disc? I had to change my motherboard.
what board did you have and what did you move to? processor type?
the kernel should have the modules you need to operate without too much issue unless you moved to a 64 board
my asus A7V600-X broke and now I have a Asus A7V880, sempron
when I start up I get a kernel panic...
when does it panic? what error is displayed? the A7v 600-x is that amd non-64 too?
pivot_root: No such file or directory
are your drives in different order now?
nah is hda still in the hda slot etc?
did anything change besides the board? is everything else the same?
I have had to put the vga card on another slot
and I don't have 2 cd drives anymore
it can't find /dev/console something got screwed up - are you using sata whats your drive layout?
do you have the ubuntu install disc or another disc which will allow you to access your drives and run cfdisk?
